solution:
The box has volume $30^3=27000$ cubic cm.

The sphere has radius $30/2=15$ and volume $\frac{4}{3}\pi (15^3) = 2\cdot 15 \cdot 2\cdot 15\cdot 5\pi = 30^2\cdot 5\pi = 4500\pi$ cubic cm.

Thus, the volume of the space in the box not occupied by the sphere is $\boxed{27000-4500\pi}$ cubic cm.
model_solution:
$30^3 = 270000$ cubic centimeters.
The radius of the sphere is half the length of the diameter, so it is $30 \div 2 = 15$ centimeters. The volume of the sphere is $\frac{4}{3}\pi r^3$, so $\frac{4}{3}\pi (15)^3 = 4\cdot 15^2\cdot 5\pi = 2250\pi$ cubic centimeters.
steps: The radius of the sphere is half the length of the diameter, so it is $30 \div 2 = 15$ centimeters. The volume of the sphere is $\frac{4}{3}\pi r^3$, so $\frac{4}{3}\pi (15)^3 = 4\cdot 15^2\cdot 5\pi = 2250\pi$ cubic centimeters.
full_steps: The radius of the sphere is half the length of the diameter, so it is $30 \div 2 = 15$ centimeters. The volume of the sphere is $\frac{4}{3}\pi r^3$, so $\frac{4}{3}\pi (15)^3 = 4\cdot 15^2\cdot 5\pi = 2250\pi$ cubic centimeters.
